pageContext.description:
An incomplete copper alloy spearhead tip dating to the Bronze Age (c. 1500-800 BC)

The object consists of the tip of the spearhead only, the rest of the body and socket are missing. The blade is sub-triangular in shape and lozenge in section. It has a prominent, pinched mid-rib running down the centre and the blades narrow towards the edges. The edges are rough and irregular as is the tip and break. The overall surface has a smooth dark brown patina with large areas of pitting.

Dimensions: Length 56.99mm; width 15.81mm; thickness 6.99mm; weight 11.72g

The object is too fragmentary to determine a typology or specific date, see Davis 2016 & 2017 for details.
